title: DSM-5 Criteria for Posttraumatic Stress Disorder
description: Diagnostic criteria for posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) based on DSM-5. Evaluates trauma exposure and four symptom clusters: intrusion, avoidance, negative alterations in cognitions/mood, and alterations in arousal/reactivity.

parameters.name: trauma_exposure
parameters.description: Exposure to actual or threatened death, serious injury, or sexual violence through direct experience, witnessing, learning it happened to close family/friend, or repeated/extreme exposure to aversive details

parameters.name: intrusive_memories
parameters.description: CRITERION B1: Recurrent, involuntary, and intrusive distressing memories of the traumatic event(s)

parameters.name: traumatic_nightmares
parameters.description: CRITERION B2: Recurrent distressing dreams in which the content and/or affect of the dream are related to the traumatic event(s)

parameters.name: dissociative_reactions
parameters.description: CRITERION B3: Dissociative reactions (e.g., flashbacks) in which the individual feels or acts as if the traumatic event(s) were recurring

parameters.name: psychological_distress
parameters.description: CRITERION B4: Intense or prolonged psychological distress at exposure to internal or external cues that symbolize or resemble an aspect of the traumatic event(s)

parameters.name: physiological_reactions
parameters.description: CRITERION B5: Marked physiological reactions to internal or external cues that symbolize or resemble an aspect of the traumatic event(s)

parameters.name: avoidance_thoughts
parameters.description: CRITERION C1: Avoidance of or efforts to avoid distressing memories, thoughts, or feelings about or closely associated with the traumatic event(s)

parameters.name: avoidance_reminders
parameters.description: CRITERION C2: Avoidance of or efforts to avoid external reminders (people, places, conversations, activities, objects, situations) that arouse distressing memories, thoughts, or feelings about or closely associated with the traumatic event(s)

parameters.name: inability_remember
parameters.description: CRITERION D1: Inability to remember an important aspect of the traumatic event(s) (typically due to dissociative amnesia and not to head injury, alcohol, or drugs)

parameters.name: negative_beliefs
parameters.description: CRITERION D2: Persistent and exaggerated negative beliefs or expectations about oneself, others, or the world (e.g., 'I am bad,' 'No one can be trusted,' 'The world is completely dangerous')

parameters.name: distorted_blame
parameters.description: CRITERION D3: Persistent, distorted cognitions about the cause or consequences of the traumatic event that lead the individual to blame himself/herself or others

parameters.name: negative_emotional_state
parameters.description: CRITERION D4: Persistent negative emotional state (e.g., fear, horror, anger, guilt, or shame)

parameters.name: diminished_interest
parameters.description: CRITERION D5: Markedly diminished interest or participation in significant activities

parameters.name: detachment_estrangement
parameters.description: CRITERION D6: Feelings of detachment or estrangement from others

parameters.name: inability_positive_emotions
parameters.description: CRITERION D7: Persistent inability to experience positive emotions (e.g., happiness, satisfaction, love, joy)

parameters.name: irritability_aggression
parameters.description: CRITERION E1: Irritable behavior and angry outbursts (with little or no provocation) typically expressed as verbal or physical aggression toward people or objects

parameters.name: reckless_behavior
parameters.description: CRITERION E2: Reckless or self-destructive behavior

parameters.name: hypervigilance
parameters.description: CRITERION E3: Hypervigilance

parameters.name: exaggerated_startle
parameters.description: CRITERION E4: Exaggerated startle response

parameters.name: concentration_problems
parameters.description: CRITERION E5: Problems with concentration

parameters.name: sleep_disturbance
parameters.description: CRITERION E6: Sleep disturbance (e.g., difficulty falling or staying asleep or restless sleep)

parameters.name: duration_one_month
parameters.description: CRITERION F: Duration of the disturbance is more than 1 month

parameters.name: functional_impairment
parameters.description: CRITERION G: The disturbance causes clinically significant distress or impairment in social, occupational, or other important areas of functioning

parameters.name: not_substance_medical
parameters.description: CRITERION H: The disturbance is NOT attributable to the physiological effects of a substance (e.g., medication, alcohol) or another medical condition

parameters.name: dissociative_symptoms
parameters.description: DISSOCIATIVE SUBTYPE: Persistent or recurrent symptoms of depersonalization (feelings of unreality, detachment from oneself) or derealization (feelings of unreality about surroundings)

ranges.description: Does not meet DSM-5 PTSD criteria
ranges.interpretation: Does not meet DSM-5 criteria for PTSD. Consider other trauma-related disorders, acute stress disorder, or subclinical PTSD symptoms. Refer for comprehensive trauma evaluation if clinical concerns persist.

Meets DSM-5 criteria for Posttraumatic Stress Disorder. Requires comprehensive trauma-informed psychiatric evaluation and treatment planning. Consider evidence-based treatments such as trauma-focused psychotherapy (CPT, PE, EMDR) and/or pharmacotherapy.

ranges.description: Meets criteria for PTSD with dissociative features
ranges.interpretation: Meets DSM-5 criteria for PTSD with Dissociative Subtype. This more severe form includes depersonalization or derealization symptoms. Requires specialized trauma treatment with attention to dissociative symptoms and safety planning.

references: American Psychiatric Association. Diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorders: DSM-5. 5th ed. Washington, DC: American Psychiatric Association; 2013.
Weathers FW, Litz BT, Keane TM, Palmieri PA, Marx BP, Schnurr PP. The PTSD Checklist for DSM-5 (PCL-5). National Center for PTSD; 2013.

Bovin MJ, Marx BP, Weathers FW, Gallagher MW, Rodriguez P, Schnurr PP, Keane TM. Psychometric properties of the PTSD Checklist for Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders-Fifth Edition (PCL-5) in veterans. Psychol Assess. 2016;28(11):1379-1391. doi: 10.1037/pas0000254.
formula: DSM-5 PTSD diagnosis requires: A) Trauma exposure + B) At least 1 intrusion symptom (B1-B5) + C) At least 1 avoidance symptom (C1-C2) + D) At least 2 negative alterations in cognitions/mood (D1-D7) + E) At least 2 alterations in arousal/reactivity (E1-E6) + F) Duration >1 month + G) Functional impairment + H) Not due to substance/medical condition. Dissociative subtype diagnosed if dissociative symptoms also present.
notes: This is a diagnostic aid for clinical evaluation, not a substitute for comprehensive trauma assessment.
Criterion A (trauma exposure) is mandatory for PTSD diagnosis.
At least 1 symptom from Criterion B (intrusion) is required.
At least 1 symptom from Criterion C (avoidance) is required.
At least 2 symptoms from Criterion D (negative cognitions/mood) are required.
At least 2 symptoms from Criterion E (arousal/reactivity) are required.
Symptoms must persist for more than 1 month (distinguishes from Acute Stress Disorder).
Functional impairment is required for diagnosis.
Must rule out substance-induced or medical condition-related symptoms.
Dissociative subtype applies when depersonalization or derealization symptoms are present.
Consider delayed onset specifier if criteria not met until ≥6 months after trauma.
Assess suicide risk and safety planning immediately in all trauma survivors.
Use validated instruments like PCL-5 for comprehensive symptom assessment.
